details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/data/transform_markers.py example shows a scatter plot of the Palmer penuguins dataset, color- and marker-mapped by species. The x-axis is flipper length (mm) and the y-axis is body mass (g).
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/latex_blackbody_radiation.py example shows plot of spectral radiance curves for an ideal radiating blackbody at various temperatures with mathtext axis labels.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/latex_normal_distribution.py example shows a plot of the sampled and ideal Gaussian distribution with mathtext axis tick labels.
Thumbnail link to the examples/specialized/graph/node_and_edge_attributes.py example shows a network graph plot of the NetworkX karate club dataset with large circles for vertices.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/hexbin.py example shows a hexbin plot of 2d random (Gaussian) data points, colormapped by density with the Viridis palette.

Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/sprint.py example shows a scatter plot comparing historical Olympic sprint times to the 2012 record set by Usain Bolt. The x-axis marks time behind the record and the y-axis marks olympic years.

Thumbnail link to the examples/specialized/categorical/ridgeplot.py example shows a ridgeline plot using the Perceptions of Probability dataset with a smoothed distribution displayed for each probability category on the y-axis.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/hex_tile.py example shows a hex tile plot of binned 2d random (Gaussian) data points, colormapped by density with the Viridis palette.
Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/colormapped.py example shows a simple bar plot with bars for six categories of fruit on the x-axis, and bars shaded with the Bright6 palette.

Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/intervals.py example shows an interval chart showing Olympic sprint time data as intervals using blue horizontal bars for times, with a bar for earch year on the y-axis.

Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/tools/range_tool.py example shows a column of two plots of timeseries plots of stock price data. The bottom plot shows all the data and has a range tool for controlling the viewport of the top plot.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/pie.py example shows a pie chart of random data with a legend.
Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/mixed.py example shows a bar chart of synthetic monthly sales data, grouped by quarter. A line showing each quarterly average is overlaid.

Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/nested_colormapped.py example shows a grouped bar chart on a hierachical categorical axis of years for different categories of fruit. Each group has a silver, blue, and red bar corresponding to random values for years 2015, 2016 and 2017.

Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/schrodinger.py example shows solutions of Schrödinger’s equation for the motion of a particle in one dimension in a parabolic potential well for eight energy levels, with mathtext labels for each solution.
Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/pandas_groupby_colormapped.py example shows a bar chart of MPG vs cylinders using the Auto MPG dataset, colormapped by the number of cylinders.

Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/pandas_groupby_nested.py example shows a grouped bar chart of MPG vs cylinders and manufacturer, using the Auto MPG dataset. The bars are grouped and colormapped by the number of cylinders.
Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/stacked.py example shows a stacked bar chart for random data for six categories of fruit. Each row in the stack corresponds to a different year.
Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/stacked_split.py example.

Thumbnail link to the examples/specialized/categorical/scatter_jitter.py example shows a categorical scatter plot of several years of GitHub commits. The y-axis is day of the week and the x-axis is time of day, with scater points jittered to avoid overlap

Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/nested.py example shows a grouped bar chart on a hierachical categorical axis of years for different categories of fruit. Each group has three blue bars corresponding to random values for years 2015, 2016 and 2017.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/candlestick.py example shows a candlestick plot of historical Microsoft stock prices.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/legend.py example shows a row of two plots that have sine waves in different scatter and line styles, illustrated in accompanying legends.
Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/colors.py example shows a simple bar chart of six bars shaded according to the Bright6 palette.

Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/box_annotation.py example shows a timeseries plot of glucose data readings with red box annotations marking regions where the readings are too high or too low.

Thumbnail link to the examples/specialized/categorical/les_mis.py example shows a reproduction of D3’s Les Misérables Co-occurrence chart that illustrates which characters were in scenes together with a shaded square in the matrix plot.

Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/dodged.py example shows a grouped bar chart using a visual dodge on the bars, rather than a hierarchical axis. Each group has a silver, blue, and red bar illustrated in the accompanying legend.

Thumbnail link to the examples/specialized/categorical/heatmap_unemployment.py example shows a categorical heatmap of monthly US unemployment data from 1948 to 2016. The x-axis is years and the y-axis is month of the year.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/stocks.py example shows a scatter plot of stock close prices with a line showing average prices. Shaded grid bands are underneath.
Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/basic/hatch_grid_band.py example shows a sine wave with hatched grid bands underneath.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/image_rgba.py example shows an image plot of synthetic RGBA data.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/dotplot.py example shows a dot plot of synthetic data for eight categories.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/periodic.py example shows a plot that renders the periodic table of elements.

Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/histogram.py example shows a gridplot of four plots. Each plot has a histogram of sampled data from a statistical distribution overlaid with a line showing the ideal distribution curve.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/image.py example shows a plot with a colormapped two-dimensonal sine surface.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/slider.py example shows a layout with a sine plot on the left and sliders on the right to control the sine wave properties such as frequency and phase.

Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/data/transform_jitter.py example shows a column of two categorical scatter plots of random data. The top has no jitter applied, may scatter points overlap. The bottom has jitter applied to distinguish points better.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/lorenz.py example shows a plot of the Lorenz attractor using the MultiLine glyph.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/color_scatter.py example shows a multicolored scatter plot of random data with hover tool.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/color_sliders.py example shows a layout with RGB sliders on the left to control a plot on the right. A colorbar with hover tool is underneath.
Thumbnail link to the examples/specialized/stats/splom.py example shows a SPLOM gridplot of the penguins data set.
Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/layouts/anscombe.py example shows a gridplot of four scatter and regression line plots illustrating Anscombe's Quartet.
Thumbnail link to the examples/geo/texas_hover_map.py example shows a color-mapped map plot based on Texas unemployment rate per county, colormapped using the Viridis palette.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/markers.py example shows all the different scatter marker types available in Bokeh on a single plot.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/burtin.py example shows a reproduction of Burtin's hitorical antibiotics plot.
Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/basic.py example shows a simple bar chart for counts for categories of fruits.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/stacked_area.py example shows a stacked area plot of synthetic data for ten series, colormapped using the Sunset palette, with a legend at the top.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/elements.py example shows a scatter plot of density vs atomic weight of atomic elements, colormapped by their melting points.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/boxplot.py example shows a box plot of synthetic data for six categories.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/logplot.py example shows a plot of six basic mathematical functions such as y=x and y=x**2 on a log-scale using different lines styles for each.
Thumbnail link to the examples/geo/eclipse.py example shows a plot of US states overlaid with a trajectory marking the path of the August 2017 solar eclipse.
Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/bessel.py example shows a plot with the first four Bessel function J_0 to J_3 with mathtext labels and a mathtext title.
Thumbnail link to the examples/specialized/contour/contour.py example shows an iso-contour plot with ten levels between -2 and 2.
